name: Automate Template Delivery to Customers from Stripe Payments

nodes.name: Get row(s) in sheet in Google Sheets

parameters.content:
## Stripe Data Collection

ðŸ’³ Get many charges (Stripe)
Fetches all charge data from Stripe; later filtered to keep only completed payments.

## Filter â€“ Successful Charges

ðŸ” Status check = succeeded
Removes failed/pending charges so only paid orders continue.

## Send a message (Gmail)

ðŸ“¨ Email dispatch
Sends the AI-generated subject and HTML body to the customerâ€™s email.

## AI Agent â€“ Email Composer

ðŸ§© Personalized HTML email
Uses Azure OpenAI (GPT-4o-mini) to craft thank-you emails with access link, password, onboarding tip, and sign-off.

## Loop Over Items of New Purchases

ðŸ” Batch sender
Iterates through each new purchase record for email generation & delivery.

##  Check Automation Exists

âš¡ Final guard
Verifies automation data is present before generating and sending emails.

## SQL Combine

ðŸ§® Exclude already-logged customers
SQL logic filters out rows already present in the purchase sheet.

## Customer Matching 

ðŸ§  Product-name matcher
Matches successful Stripe charges to automation rows (handles â€œ[n8n]â€ suffix and trims). Outputs final, ready-to-email JSON.

## Get row(s) in sheet â€“ Purchase Sheet Lookup

ðŸ§¾ De-dup check
Reads existing entries in â€œAutomation Purchase Sheetâ€ to avoid logging duplicates.

##  Combine Stripe + Sheet Data

ðŸ”„ Stripe Ã— Sheet join
Brings together payment info and automation metadata for a complete record.

## Check Match Found

ðŸ§® Sheet match gate
Only proceeds when a valid row is found for the purchased automation.

## AI Agent  â†’ Google Sheets Lookup

ðŸ” Automation metadata lookup
Finds matching automation by product/Name in â€œn8n Automations â€“ Zip Filesâ€ sheet.

##  Check Required Fields

ðŸš¦ Field validation
Ensures order_reference, product_name, customer_name, and email are present before moving on.

## Merge Logic Format Data

ðŸ§  Normalize fields
Builds clean JSON (customer_name, email, product_name, amount, currency, status, receipt_url, created).

## Merge Charge + PaymentIntent + Product

ðŸ”„ Data merge hub
Combines charge + payment_intent + product into one unified record per purchase.

## Get Product Details (from Payment Intent)

ðŸ§¾ Stripe Product fetch
Uses order reference from payment_intent to get product name/description/image.

## Get Payment Intent (from Charge)

ðŸ”— Stripe Payment Intent lookup
Expands each charge with its payment_intent details for richer context.

## Trigger & Data Fetch

ðŸŸ¢ Schedule Trigger
Triggers every morning (7 AM IST) to fetch latest successful Stripe purchases.

options.systemMessage:
=You are an AI assistant with access to a Google Sheets tool. Your task is as follows:

- You will receive an input phrase. This phrase represents a name.
- Use the Google Sheets tool to search for a row in the spreadsheet where the value in the "Name" column matches the input phrase with at least 80% similarity (fuzzy matching).
- First, try to find an exact match. If no exact match exists, find the closest matching name that has at least 80% similarity to the input.
- Consider variations in spelling, spacing, capitalization, and minor differences when matching names.
- If a matching row is found (either exact or fuzzy match), return the entire row as a JSON object, including all columns and their values.
- If no matching row is found with at least 80% similarity, respond with: "No matching row found for the provided name."
- If there are multiple matches with similar similarity scores (within 5% of each other), return the match with the highest similarity score.
- Do not return any extra commentary or explanationâ€”only the result.
- If there is an error accessing the spreadsheet, respond with: "Error accessing the spreadsheet."

Return ONLY a single JSON object with this exact structure:
{
  "row_number": "",
  "Name": "",
  "Google Drive Link": "",
  "Password": ""
}

No additional keys such as "response", "action", "output", or text outside the JSON.
```

## Key Changes Made:

1. **Fuzzy Matching**: Changed from "exactly matches" to "matches with at least 80% similarity"
2. **Matching Strategy**: Added instruction to try exact match first, then fuzzy match
3. **Flexibility**: Added consideration for spelling variations, spacing, and capitalization
4. **Best Match Selection**: If multiple similar matches exist, return the one with highest similarity

nodes.name: AI Agent  â†’ Google Sheets Lookup

parameters.content:
## Append or update row in sheet  For  Tracking

ðŸ“Š Audit & reporting
Logs each processed purchase and email outcome into â€œAutomation Purchase Sheetâ€.

nodes.name: Get row(s) in sheet â€“ Purchase Sheet Lookup

parameters.query:
SELECT input1.*
FROM input1
LEFT JOIN input2
  ON LOWER(TRIM(input1.customerEmail)) = LOWER(TRIM(input2.email))
     OR LOWER(TRIM(input1.customerName)) = LOWER(TRIM(input2.name))
WHERE input2.email IS NULL

nodes.name: Loop Over Items of New Purchases

options.systemMessage:
=You are an AI email writing assistant specialized in crafting personalized, professional, and heartfelt thank-you emails for customers who have purchased automation templates from Techdome. You will receive structured input with the following details: - Customer name - Customer email - Name of the automation purchased - Google Drive link to the files - Password to access the files - Date of purchase Your goal is to create a beautifully formatted HTML email that: 1. **Feels human and genuine** â€” use warm, conversational, and appreciative language. 2. **Highlights the automation name naturally** â€” make it feel special, not mechanical. 3. **Shows gratitude clearly** â€” thank the customer sincerely for trusting Techdome. 4. **Includes clear access details**: - Add a visible and styled hyperlink to the Google Drive link. - Display the password prominently but professionally (bold or highlighted). - Add a note to keep it confidential. 5. **Gives a short onboarding tip** â€” 1â€“2 lines about importing or using the automation. 6. **Encourages further engagement** â€” invite them to explore other automations or reach out for help. 7. **Signs off gracefully** from Rahul Joshi (CEO & Co-Founder, Techdome) â€” include his name and title at the end. **Tone:** Friendly, confident, and professional â€” sounding like Rahul personally wrote it. **Formatting Rules (HTML)**: - Use `

` for paragraphs, `` for bold, `` for links. - Avoid unnecessary line breaks or raw URLs. - Keep spacing clean and make it easy to read. - Do not use Markdown â€” only valid HTML. **Example style:** ```html

Dear {{ $json.customerName }},

Thank you so much for purchasing the {{ $json.automationName }} automation! We truly appreciate your trust in Techdome.

You can access your automation files here: Access Your Automation Files

Use the password {{ $json.password }} to open the files. Please keep it confidential for your security.

Once you open the folder, follow the included documentation to import and start using your automation instantly.

If you need help or wish to explore other automations, feel free to reply to this email â€” weâ€™d love to assist.

Warm regards,
Rahul Joshi
CEO & Co-Founder, Techdome
